feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Document and Reporting Compliance
feed.subtitle: SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: How to check logs in Process edocument inbound messages
entry.content:
Hi

We are implementing SAP DRC with SAP S4 hana public cloud to create Supplier invocies 

Step1 -We are extracting supplier invoices of chile and uploading to Upload incoming message app.

Step2-We are scheduling job to create instance of edocument for which we are using app Process edocument inbound message

After Uploading it is showing process with Errors and there is no logs in message interface logs .

Need the resolution steps to see error logs.

entry.title: SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Germany
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We are using SAP DRC to receive invoices from suppliers for the German mandate.

We are having difficulties connecting our SAP DRC to the PEPPOL network, even though we have configured it according to the SAP note. We sent a test invoice, but we did not receive anything in our SAP DRC (using the OZG_RE test portal and Billit).. Can you help us with the configuration of SAP DRC on the PEPPOL network? Why does the DRC not have any records of entry into the Peppol network. How can we make it an access point on the PEPPOL network so that invoices sent to our participant IDs are forwarded to our SAP DRC? Has anyone else been through this?
Thank you.

Best regards

entry.title: Romania VAT300
entry.content:
Romania VAT300 declaration for Public Cloud Edition

Dear all,

In Romania there was a legal change in the VAT  regulation. One of the mandatory reports is VAT300 declaration. 

I have seen that there was a Hotfix in Oct on 31.10.2025 including also this topic: https://me.sap.com/notes/3630491/E.

But in the tax box structures  definition I was not able to find the following lines included in the declaration: 9.1, 24.1 and 25.1.

I could not find an additional information in the OSS notes. It seems that the stucture is not the latest one.

Can anyone generate successfully the D300 declaration in Public Cloud for Romania, save it and validate the generated report with ANAF? If yes, I would kindly ask for your guidance.

Thank you.

Kind Regards

entry.title: Issue with Withholding Tax Codes Not Appearing in DRC Configure Value Mapping ‚Äì Colombia Localizatio
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We are currently implementing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (Colombia localization), including Document and Report Compliance (DRC) for electronic invoicing with the DIAN.

The communication channel with the tax authority is working correctly ‚Äî invoices are successfully sent and return with an Approved status.

However, we are facing an issue specifically in the Configure Value Mapping area.

üîç Issue Summary

In the Configure Value Mapping app, only the VAT Tax Codes (e.g., codes starting with A* or V* for sales and purchasing VAT) are visible and available for mapping to the Tax Code ID required by the DIAN.

But the withholding tax codes configured in our system do not appear in the Value Mapping list.

These include:

  • RETE-IVA

  • RETE-ICA

  • ICA

  • Self-withholding (Autorretecci√≥n) types

  • Other withholding tax codes configured internally (our customer uses codes starting with 8*)

These withholding tax codes are correctly configured in the system, work in the accounting simulations, and are already being used in multiple test scenarios.
However, they do not show up in the Configure Value Mapping app, which prevents us from linking them to the Tax Code IDs specified by the tax authority.

üìÑ Impact

When generating the electronic invoice PDF, all fields related to withholding taxes appear empty.

Since the withholding tax codes cannot be mapped (because they do not appear in the Value Mapping catalog), the DRC processing does not include them in the XML/PDF output.

‚ùì Question for the SAP Community

Where in CBC or within the Document and Report Compliance configuration should Colombia withholding tax codes be mapped so that they appear in Configure Value Mapping?

Is there an additional configuration step or specific prerequisite for withholding tax codes to appear as eligible values in the mapping catalog?
Currently, only VAT tax codes are being recognized by the system as ‚ÄúTax Code ID‚Äù candidates.

We would appreciate guidance on:

  • Whether Colombia withholding tax codes are expected to appear in Value Mapping

  • If they must be created or exposed through a different configuration artifact

  • Whether any CBC configuration node must be enabled for withholding tax mapping

  • Or if withholding taxes are not supported for mapping in the current DRC scope for Colombia

We will attach screenshots showing where VAT codes are visible, and where withholding tax codes (8*) do not appear.

Thank you in advance for your help and insights.

entry.title: GSTRR 9 and GSTR 9C not available in the Document and Reporting Compliance
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Good Day!

Currently, in SAP Public Cloud, GSTR-9 and GSTR-9C are not available under Document and Reporting Compliance. Kindly suggest an alternate solution for handling these requirements.

Kind Regards,

Sam

entry.title: Issue with Unit of Measure Mapping in Document and Report Compliance for Colombia (DIAN Requirements
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We are currently configuring Document and Report Compliance (DRC) for Colombia in an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition implementation, and we encountered an issue related to the Unit of Measure (UoM) mapping during electronic invoice generation.

While generating the invoice XML, the system retrieves the Unit_OF_Measure code from the value mapping configuration. However, we noticed that several standard SAP UoMs do not have a direct equivalent in the fiscal authority‚Äôs database (DIAN).

For example:

  • In S/4HANA Cloud, the unit ‚ÄúPI ‚Äì Piece‚Äù exists and is commonly used in logistics and sales processes.

  • However, in the DIAN catalog, there is no unit of measure for ‚Äúpiece‚Äù, only options like DPC (Dozen Pieces) and other grouped units.

This creates a mismatch, since the SAP standard UoM does not appear in the official DIAN list, and therefore it is not clear how we should properly map these units to comply with DIAN‚Äôs required XML structure.

My questions are:

  1. How should we handle UoM mapping in DRC when the DIAN catalog does not include a direct equivalent for SAP standard units such as PI (Piece)?

  2. Is there an SAP-recommended approach or a standard mapping table for Colombia that aligns S/4HANA Cloud UoMs with DIAN-approved UoMs?

  3. Is it possible (or recommended) to create a custom mapping in Value Mapping for units not listed by DIAN, or must we adapt the business process to use only DIAN-supported units?

  4. Has anyone faced this issue in previous Colombian DRC implementations, and what was the accepted solution?

Any guidance or reference to official SAP notes or documentation for Colombia‚Äôs DRC unit-of-measure mapping would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: Book Depreciation Plan report SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud edition BULGARIA
entry.content:
Hello, 

we are implementing SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud solution to a Bulgarian client. Although we know that the Book Depreciation Plan (a.k.a. BGLOCS/FI_AA_BOOK_DEPR in the older SAP) report was marked as obsolete and SAP ergo no longer includes it into the DRC legally requested reports, the client would still like to have it available in the new SAP Public Cloud system. 

The plan shall contain the following minimum number of details:

  • date of acquisition;
  • date of commissioning;
  • useful life;
  • carrying amount;
  • residual value;
  • depreciation amount;
  • depreciation method;
  • depreciation rate;
  • annual depreciation quota;
  • reserve for subsequent assessments;
  • date of decommissioning;
  • year of change in the depreciation method or useful life.

We have analyzed applications like Asset History Sheet, Depreciation Lists, Asset Transactions but none of them could offer the wanted values. 

Please advise. 
I will reward Kudos to helpful solutions!!!

entry.title: Still problems with bindung in SAP Document Reporting Complance after SAP solved the main problem.
entry.content:
Hi, 

it seems SAP experienced issues with changing certificates in the central truststore within their own infrastructure around December 3rd and 4th, 2025. We also had to change one of our certificates but encountered significant problems with the new certificate from our hosting provider for our on-premise systems. and Cloud Connection The SAP DRC connection on the production instance and PRD ECC are working again after I rebound them with the same certificate as before. However, the test system uses a different certificate, and I couldn't get it working with the new one. Changing the certificate again didn't help either. A login dialog for the Integration Suite always appears via EDOC_COCKPIT, but there's no connection to the Integration Suite. Do you have any suggestions for a solution in this case?

Thx, Uwe

entry.title: Restricting Company Code Access in Run Statutory Reports in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi,

I would like to restrict the company code selection in app: Run Statutory Reports so that each user can access only their assigned company code.

I have tried applying the restriction in the custom role, but it does not work when running reports in app: Run Statutory Reports.

Could you please advise how to resolve this issue?

entry.title: Support needed ‚Äì Change Log Report for SAP HCM Infotypes
entry.content:
Hello,

I need support to develop a report/transaction in SAP HCM that shows which user made changes and the date/time of each change for the following infotypes:
0000, 0001, 0002, 0006, 0008, 0009, 0016, and 0021 (for IT0021, the report must display records by dependent ‚Äì validate SUBTY).

The report should read the information directly from the standard PA tables.

Could you please advise on the best approach and required tables/fields?

Thank you

Vanessa

entry.title: Customize emails for e-invoices sent via DRC Cloud Edition
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

we have integrated SAP DRC Cloud Edition with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

We want to send out e-invoices (ZUGFeRD) via email. The scenario works and the invoice is sent out.

But we would like to customize the email (subject, body) that is sent out (like we could do for other invoices that are sent out via Output Management directly from Public Cloud).

Does anybody know if that is even possible and if so, how?

BR Tobi

entry.title: No eDocumments generated from invoices in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi, 

We are implementing electronic invoice for Uruguay and since there is no SAP localization for this country we are using Germany as a base. 

We configured the eDocument types that must be generated with each Billing Document Type using the app
"Assign eDocument Type to Billing Document Type". 

Did the same for Accounting Document Type

Then we create an invoice of type F2 and check the eDocument Cockpit App and adjust the filters to meet the selection criteria that shows the invoices we created:


After Executing no eDocuments are shown meaning that no eDocument were created from the billing documents. 

An analogue procedure was carried out with Accounting Documents with the same result. 

I would appreciate if anyone can help identify the problem or missing configuration. 

Thanks!

entry.title: Luxembourg eCDF - Generate Financial Statement (RPFILU_AFS)
entry.content:
Hello, 

when I generate eCDF XML file in the Generate Financial Statement - Luxembourg (RPFILU_AFS), the values for <Agent> and <Declarer> section are the default ones provided by SAP. 

How can they be changed? Please note that I did the configuration in the SSCUI 101071 Setting Up Your Statutory Reporting in CBC where I defined the LU_EVATECDF_DECL_... and LU_EVATECDF_SEND_... attributes. But unfortunately it only displays in VAT reports via Run statutory Reports app, but not in RPFILU_AFS. 

Where can I maintain the Electronic Financial Data Collection Platform parameters? 

Many thanks

entry.title: Issue with Electronic Credit Notes ‚Äì Missing Period Dates and Email Mapping (Colombia Localization)
entry.content:
Hello,

We would like to request your support regarding an issue we are currently facing with electronic credit notes in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition ‚Äì Colombia localization.

At the moment, we are actively working on electronic invoicing, and we have already validated that standard electronic invoices are being generated and sent correctly to the tax authority, without any issues. These documents are being processed successfully and are compliant.

However, now that we are starting to work specifically with electronic credit notes, we have identified errors during the generation and submission of the electronic document to the Colombian tax authority (DIAN).

Issue description

When the electronic credit note is sent to the tax authority, the following errors are returned:

  1. Missing period dates
    The XML file generated by the system is not populating certain mandatory fields related to:

    • Start date of the billing period

    • End date of the billing period

    These dates seem to be required by the tax authority and associated with some part of the document, but we are unable to identify where these fields should be captured or derived from within the credit note document in the system. The system does not appear to recognize or populate these values in any section of the XML.

  2. Customer / Vendor email not mapped
    We are also receiving an error indicating that the email address is not informed for the customer or vendor involved in the credit note.

    However, we have validated that:

    • The email address is correctly maintained in the Business Partner master data.

    • Despite this, the email is not being mapped or reflected in the electronic document, resulting in the error message from the tax authority.

Request for support

We would appreciate your help to understand:

  • Why these fields (period start and end dates) are not being populated in the XML for electronic credit notes.

  • From which configuration or document fields these values should be derived.

  • Why the customer/vendor email, although maintained in master data, is not being mapped into the electronic document.

  • If there are specific configuration points related to Document & Reporting Compliance / Statutory Reporting for Colombia that should be reviewed or adjusted for credit notes.

We would especially appreciate guidance from someone with experience in Colombia localization and electronic document compliance configuration.

Evidence

Attached you will find:

  • Screenshots of the system errors.

  • The messages returned by the tax authority.

  • Supporting evidence showing the master data configuration.

Thank you in advance for your support. We look forward to your guidance to resolve these issues as soon as possible.

entry.title: PriceAmount
entry.content: Hi, for tag <PriceAmount> we map GSV price. Peppol explanation of the field is the item net price but according to notes we have Gross price per 1,000 units. Has anyone  got any doubts about this?

entry.title: Public Cloud DRC Turkey Sales List Error while checking in and storing: SALES_LIST.XML
entry.content:
Dear All, 

we are using S/4 Public Cloud. In App Statutory Reports, Report TR_SALESINVOICE_REP following the docuumentation: Sales Invoice List | SAP Help Portal

we get the error message:

  • Error while checking in and storing: SALES_LIST.XML

However the Diagnosis in the log is very vague.

Diagnosis

You tried to add a document into a content repository.

System Response

Check-in of the document failed due to one of the following reasons:

 

  • Object does not exist
  • Save Not Allowed
  • No Authorization
  • No files for physical object
  • Incorrect memory type
  • Locking error
  • Exception in application exit
  • Storage Category
  • Foreign lock
  • No content
  • Others
Do we have someone who has already been able to resolve the error message specifically and how, or an SAP product expert who can provide concrete guidance?
 
Many thanks,
Sebastian

entry.title: Public Cloud DRC Turkey Input VAT Declaration
entry.content:
Dear All,

in SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud, App Statutory Reporting, Report TR_INPUT_VAT (Input VAT Declaration | SAP Help Portal) we get the error message:

  • Document 'Input VAT Declaration' generation failed

however there is no long text or any other information available in the log. 

Do we have someone who has already been able to resolve the error message specifically and how, or an SAP product expert who can provide concrete guidance?
 
Many thanks,
Sebastian

entry.title: DRC Colombia ‚Äì Number Range Assignment for Support Documents (Non-Obligated Vendors) in S/4HANA Clou
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We are currently implementing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 with Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) for Colombia, and we would like to request clarification regarding the number range assignment for Support Documents (Documento Soporte) issued to vendors not obligated to invoice electronically, as required by DIAN.

Context

  • DIAN has issued one Software ID for the company.

  • Using the standard app ‚ÄúGet Tax Authority Invoice Number Ranges (Colombia)‚Äù, the system successfully retrieves and assigns electronic invoice number ranges.

  • However, when executing the app again, only electronic invoice ranges are returned, and no number ranges related to Support Documents are retrieved.

Key Question

For Documento Soporte, which requires a separate DIAN-authorized number range and resolution, we would like to understand the standard SAP approach in S/4HANA Cloud Public:

  1. Is there any other standard app to retrieve Support Document number ranges from DIAN?

  2. Should Support Document ranges always be maintained manually in S/4HANA Cloud?

  3. If manual maintenance is expected:

    • Which standard configuration apps / SSCUIs should be used to register the DIAN resolution and number range?

    • How should this range be correctly assigned to the Support Document eDocument type in DRC?

  4. Is it expected behavior that ‚ÄúGet Tax Authority Invoice Number Ranges (Colombia)‚Äù only retrieves electronic invoice ranges and excludes Support Documents?

Goal

We want to ensure:

  • Full compliance with DIAN regulations

  • Usage of standard functionality only (no custom developments)

  • Correct and auditable numbering for Support Documents in DRC Colombia

Any guidance, official SAP notes, or best-practice confirmation would be highly appreciated.

Thank you very much for your support.

Best regards,

Juan Sebastian Valencia

entry.title: eDoc Cockpit - Connection to partner timed o ut after 600s
entry.content:
Hello, 

We have an e-invoice in the eDocument Cockpit with a 30MB attachment. When we transfer this, the following error occurs.

Proxy-Fehler SOAP:1023 SRT: Processing error in Internet Commun: ication Framework: ("Connection to partner timed o ut after 600s. ")
Meldungsnr. /AIF/MES091

 

Do you know of a solution here?

Thanks and greetings

Marco
